definitions.text: the land on which real estate is located
examples: he built the house on land leased from the city

definitions.text: material in the top layer of the surface of the earth in which plants can grow (especially with reference to its quality or use)
examples: the land had never been plowed
good agricultural soil

definitions.text: territory over which rule or control is exercised
examples: his domain extended into Europe
he made it the law of the land

definitions.text: the solid part of the earth's surface
examples: the plane turned away from the sea and moved back over land
the earth shook for several minutes
he dropped the logs on the ground

definitions.text: the territory occupied by a nation
examples: he returned to the land of his birth
he visited several European countries

definitions.text: a domain in which something is dominant
examples: the untroubled kingdom of reason
a land of make-believe
the rise of the realm of cotton in the south

definitions.text: extensive landed property (especially in the country) retained by the owner for his own use
examples: the family owned a large estate on Long Island

definitions.text: the people who live in a nation or country
examples: a statement that sums up the nation's mood
the news was announced to the nation
the whole country worshipped him

definitions.text: a politically organized body of people under a single government
examples: the state has elected a new president
African nations
students who had come to the nation's capitol
the country's largest manufacturer
an industrialized land

definitions.text: United States inventor who incorporated Polaroid film into lenses and invented the one step photographic process (1909-1991)
agriculture considered as an occupation or way of life
examples: farming is a strenuous life
there's no work on the land any more
The bird landed on the highest branch
The plane landed in Istanbul

definitions.text: cause to come to the ground
examples: the pilot managed to land the airplane safely
this may land you in jail
The drug smugglers landed the heroin on the beach of the island
He landed several blows on his opponent's head
The ship landed in Pearl Harbor

definitions.text: shoot at and force to come down
examples: the enemy landed several of our aircraft
